Class KeyboardReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • KeyboardReader

  • public class KeyboardReader
extends java.lang.Object
    KeyboardReader class for use in reading data from the keyboard and use in the remainder of CSCI 131 assignments.
    Since:
    2013-10-03
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pash DeVore

        public static boolean isDataAvailable()
        Determines whether data from the keyboard is waiting to be read.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • readLine

        public static java.lang.String readLine()
        Reads a line of text from the keyboard. Re-prompts for data on invalid entry.
        Returns:
        String

      • readInt

        public static int readInt()
        Reads an integer value from the keyboard. Re-prompts for data on invalid entry and notifies user of accepted values.
        Returns:
        int

      • readBoolean

        public static boolean readBoolean()
        Reads a boolean from the keyboard. Re-prompts for data on invalid entry and notifies user of accepted values.
        Returns:
        boolean

        Reads a double from the keyboard. Re-prompts for data on invalid entry and notifies user of accepted values.
        Returns:

        Reads a float from the keyboard. Re-prompts for data on invalid entry and notifies user of accepted values.
